db:abstract.db:para: This is a collection of QML Canvas examples.

db:article.db:para: Canvas is a collection of small QML examples relating to the Canvas type. Each example is a small QML file emphasizing a particular type or feature.

db:section.db:title: Running the Example
db:section.db:para: To run the example from Qt Creator, open the Welcome mode and select the example from Examples. For more information, visit Building and Running an Example.

db:section.db:title: Red Heart
db:section.db:para: Red heart uses the bezier curve API to stroke and fill a red heart.

db:section.db:title: Talk Bubble
db:section.db:para: Talk bubble uses the quadraticCurveTo() API to stroke and fill a customized talk bubble:
This example also demonstrates the fillText() API:

db:section.db:title: Squircle
db:section.db:para: Squircle uses a collection of simple moveTo() and lineTo() path APIs to draw a smooth squircle.

db:section.db:title: Rounded Rectangle
db:section.db:para: Rounded rectangle uses a collection of lineTo() and arcTo() path APIs to draw a rounded rectangle.

db:section.db:title: Smile Face
db:section.db:para: Smile face uses several paths to draw and fill a smiling face.

db:section.db:title: Clip
db:section.db:para: Clip uses the clip API to clip a given image.

db:section.db:title: Tiger
db:section.db:para: Tiger uses the SVG path API to draw a tiger with a collection of SVG path strings.
